TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder extends System.Object

summary.span: 定义一个新型或基于其他区域性和国家/地区的自定义区域性。

span.span: Defines a custom culture that is new or based on another culture and country/region.

summary.span: 自定义区域性可以安装在计算机上，然后由运行在该计算机上的任何应用程序使用。

span.span: The custom culture can be installed on a computer and subsequently used by any application that is running on that computer.

summary.span: 无法继承此类。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类保存特定于区域性的信息，如关联的语言、子语言、国家/地区、日历和文化约定。The class holds culture-specific information, such as the associated language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and cultural conventions. 此类还提供了特定于区域性的 、、和 类的实例，这些类特定于区域性特定操作（如大小写、格式化和分析日期和数字）以及比较字符串。This class also provides culture-specific instances of the , , , and classes, which are required for culture-specific operations such as casing, formatting and parsing dates and numbers, and comparing strings. 默认情况下，.NET Framework 支持表示一组预定义的区域性的 对象。By default, the .NET Framework supports objects that represent a predefined set of cultures. 有关 Windows 系统上提供的这些区域性的列表，请参阅[windows 支持的语言/区域名称列表](https://docs.microsoft.com/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-lcid/a9eac961-e77d-41a6-90a5-ce1a8b0cdb9c)中的**语言标记**列。For a list of these cultures available on Windows systems, see the **Language tag** column in the [list of language/region names supported by Windows](https://docs.microsoft.com/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-lcid/a9eac961-e77d-41a6-90a5-ce1a8b0cdb9c). 列名遵循 [BCP 47](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47) 定义的标准。Culture names follow the standard defined by [BCP 47](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). 使用 类，您可以创建一个完全新的或重写预定义区域性的自定义区域性。The class enables you to create a custom culture that is completely new or that overrides a predefined culture. 当在特定计算机上安装并注册了自定义区域性时，它将无法与预定义的 对象区分开来，并且可以实例化和使用，就像这些对象一样。When a custom culture is installed and registered on a particular computer, it becomes indistinguishable from predefined objects, and can be instantiated and used just like those objects. > [!IMPORTANT] > 请注意， 类在名为 sysglobl 的程序集中找到。Note that the class is found in an assembly named sysglobl.dll. 如果成功编译使用此类型的代码，则需要添加对 sysglobl 的引用。Successfully compiling code that uses this type requires that you add a reference to sysglobl.dll. 自定义区域性只能由对该计算机拥有管理权限的用户在计算机上进行注册。A custom culture can be registered on a computer only by a user who has administrative rights on that computer. 因此，应用通常不会创建和安装自定义区域性。Consequently, apps typically do not create and install custom cultures. 相反，你可以使用 类来创建一个特殊用途的工具，管理员可以使用该工具创建、安装和注册自定义区域性。Instead, you can use the class to create a special-purpose tool that an administrator can use to create, install, and register a custom culture. 在计算机上注册自定义区域性后，可以在应用程序中使用 类来创建自定义区域性的实例，就像针对预定义的区域性所做的一样。After the custom culture is registered on a computer, you can use the class in your app to create instances of the custom culture just as you would for a predefined culture. 如果分析为自定义区域性生成的日期和时间字符串，则应使用 或 方法而不是 或 方法来提高分析操作成功的概率。If you parse date and time strings generated for a custom culture, you should use the or method instead of the or method to improve the probability that the parse operation will succeed. 自定义区域性的日期和时间字符串可能比较复杂，因此难以分析。A date and time string for a custom culture can be complicated and therefore difficult to parse. 和 方法尝试使用几个隐式分析模式分析字符串，所有这些模式都可能失败。The and methods try to parse a string with several implicit parse patterns, all of which might fail. 与此相反， 方法要求应用程序显式指定一个或多个可能成功的准确分析模式。The method, in contrast, requires the application to explicitly designate one or more exact parse patterns that are likely to succeed. ## 定义和创建自定义区域性Defining and Creating a Custom Culture 使用 类定义和命名自定义区域性。You use the class to define and name a custom culture. 自定义区域性可以是全新的区域性、基于现有区域性的新区域性（即补充区域性）或替换现有 .NET Framework 区域性的区域性。The custom culture can be an entirely new culture, a new culture that is based on an existing culture (that is, a supplemental culture), or a culture that replaces an existing .NET Framework culture. 在每种情况下，基本步骤都是相同的：In each case, the basic steps are the same: 1. 通过调用 对象的 构造函数来实例化该对象。Instantiate a object by calling its constructor. 若要替换现有的区域性，请将该区域性的名称和 枚举值传递到构造函数。To replace an existing culture, pass that culture's name and the enumeration value to the constructor. 若要创建新的区域性或补充区域性，请传递唯一的区域性名称以及 或 枚举值。To create a new culture or a supplemental culture, pass a unique culture name and either the or enumeration value. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用 枚举值来实例化 对象，则 对象的属性将自动用要替换的 对象的值填充。If you use the enumeration value to instantiate a object, the object's properties are automatically populated with values from the object to be replaced. 2. 如果要创建新的或补充的区域性：If you are creating a new or supplemental culture: - 通过调用 方法并传递其属性值类似于你的新对象的 对象，来填充 对象的属性。Populate the object's properties by calling the method and passing a object whose property values are similar to your new object. - 通过调用 方法并传递表示自定义区域性区域的 对象，来填充 对象的区域属性。Populate the object's regional properties by calling the method and passing a object that represents the region of your custom culture. 3. 根据需要修改 对象的属性。Modify the properties of the object as necessary. 4. 如果打算在单独的例程中注册自定义区域性，请调用 方法。If you are planning to register the custom culture in a separate routine, call the method. 这会生成一个 XML 文件，你可以在单独的自定义区域性安装例程中加载和注册该文件。This generates an XML file that you can load and register in a separate custom culture installation routine. ## 注册自定义区域性Registering a Custom Culture 如果你正在开发的自定义区域性的注册应用程序与创建区域性的应用程序不同，则调用 方法加载包含自定义区域性定义的 XML 文件，并实例化 对象。If you are developing a registration application for a custom culture that is separate from the application that creates the culture, you call the method to load the XML file that contains the custom culture's definition and instantiate the object. 若要处理注册，请调用 方法。To handle the registration, call the method. 若要成功注册，注册自定义区域性的应用程序必须在目标系统上以管理权限运行;否则，对 的调用将引发 异常。For the registration to succeed, the application that registers the custom culture must be running with administrative privileges on the target system; otherwise, the call to throws an exception. > [!WARNING] > 系统之间的区域性数据可能不同。Culture data can differ between systems. 如果使用 类创建在多个系统之间统一的自定义区域性，并通过从现有的 和 对象加载数据并对其进行自定义来创建自定义区域性，则应开发两个不同的实用程序。If you are using the class to create a custom culture that is uniform across multiple systems and you are creating your custom culture by loading data from existing and objects and customizing it, you should develop two different utilities. 首先创建自定义区域性，并将其保存到 XML 文件中。The first creates the custom culture and saves it to an XML file. 第二种方法使用 方法从 XML 文件加载自定义区域性，并将其注册到目标计算机上。The second uses the method to load the custom culture from an XML file and register it on the target computer. 注册过程将执行以下任务：The registration process performs the following tasks: - 创建一个 nlp 文件，其中包含在 对象中定义的信息。Creates an .nlp file that contains the information that is defined in the object. - 将 nlp 文件存储在目标计算机上的%windir%\Globalization 系统目录中。Stores the .nlp file in the %windir%\Globalization system directory on the target computer. 这使自定义区域性的设置可以在会话之间保持。This enables the custom culture's settings to persist between sessions. （ 方法需要管理权限，因为 nlp 文件存储在系统目录中。）(The method requires administrative privileges because the .nlp file is stored in a system directory.) - 准备 .NET Framework 以便在下次请求创建新的自定义区域性时搜索%windir%\Globalization 系统目录而不是内部缓存。Prepares the .NET Framework to search the %windir%\Globalization system directory instead of an internal cache the next time there is a request to create your new custom culture. 成功注册自定义区域性后，它无法与 .NET Framework 预定义的区域性区分开来。When a custom culture is successfully registered, it is indistinguishable from the cultures that are predefined by the .NET Framework. 自定义区域性可用，直到调用 方法从本地计算机删除 nlp 文件。The custom culture is available until a call to the method removes the .nlp file from the local computer. ## 实例化自定义区域性Instantiating a Custom Culture 可以通过以下方式之一创建自定义区域性的实例：You can create an instance of the custom culture in one of the following ways: - 通过使用区域性名称调用 构造函数。By invoking the constructor with the culture name. - 通过使用区域性名称调用 方法。By calling the method with the culture name. - 通过使用区域性名称调用 方法。By calling the method with the culture name. 此外， 方法返回 对象的数组包括自定义区域性。In addition, the array of objects that is returned by the method includes the custom culture. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个自定义 ru 区域性，它表示美国中的俄文语言。The following example defines a custom ru-US culture that represents the Russian language in the United States. 该示例通过从俄语（俄罗斯） 对象和美国 对象加载设置来定义自定义区域性，然后设置多个 属性。The example defines the custom culture by loading settings from the Russian (Russia) object and the U.S. object, and then sets a number of properties. 该示例将注册自定义区域性，然后将其实例化，并使其成为当前线程的区域性。The example registers the custom culture, and then instantiates it and makes it the current thread culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks `cultureName` 参数指定新 对象的名称。The `cultureName` parameter specifies the name of the new object. `flags` 参数用于指定新的 对象是新的自定义区域性，还是替换现有的非特定区域性、特定区域性或 Windows 区域设置的 值。The `flags` parameter is used for a value that specifies whether the new object is a new custom culture, or replaces an existing neutral culture, specific culture, or Windows locale. 如果 `cultureName` 参数指定了现有的 .NET Framework 区域性、已注册的自定义区域性或从 Windows 区域设置生成的区域性，则 构造函数将使用区域性和国家/地区信息自动填充新的 对象。If the `cultureName` parameter specifies an existing .NET Framework culture, registered custom culture, or culture generated from a Windows locale, the constructor automatically populates the new object with culture and country/region information. 通过调用 和 方法，使用区域性和国家/地区信息填充新的 对象。Populate the new object with culture and country/region information by invoking the and methods. ## 自定义区域性名称Custom Culture Names 新的自定义区域性的 `cultureName` 参数的首选格式为 "[`prefix`-]`language`[-`region`] [-`suffix`[`…`]]"，其中 `language` 组件是必需的，`prefix`、`region`和 `suffix` 组件都是可选的。The preferred format of the `cultureName` parameter for a new, custom culture is "[`prefix`-]`language`[-`region`][-`suffix`[`…`]]", where the `language` component is required and the `prefix`, `region`, and `suffix` components are optional. 每个组件的最大长度为8个字符，整个 `cultureName` 参数的最大长度为84个字符。The maximum length of each component is 8 characters and the maximum length of the entire `cultureName` parameter is 84 characters. `prefix` 组件是 Internet 号码分配机构（IANA）标识。The `prefix` component is the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) identification. 为注册到 IANA 的区域性名称指定 "i-" 或 "I-"; 对于专用用途，请指定 "x-" 或 "X-"。Specify "i-" or "I-" for culture names registered with the IANA, or "x-" or "X-" for culture names reserved for private use. 否则，不需要前缀。Otherwise, the prefix is not required. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 4646 "用于识别语言的标记"。For more information, see RFC 4646, "Tags for the Identification of Languages." `cultureName` 参数的 `language` 组件指定派生自 ISO 639-1 的小写双字母代码，`region` 指定派生自 ISO 3166 的双字母双字母代码。The `language` component of the `cultureName` parameter specifies a lowercase two-letter code derived from ISO 639-1, and `region` specifies an uppercase two-letter code derived from ISO 3166. 例如，en-us 代表美国中所说的英语。For example, en-US stands for English as spoken in the United States. 缺少 `region` 组件表示非特定区域性。The absence of the `region` component signifies a neutral culture. 与包含在 .NET Framework 中的区域性名称相同的 `cultureName` 表示替换（重写）区域性。A `cultureName` that is the same as the name of a culture included with the .NET Framework signifies a replacement (override) culture. 可分配给替换区域性的属性的值会受到限制。The values that can be assigned to the properties of a replacement culture are limited. 有关此类限制的详细信息，请参阅每个属性的例外情况。For more information about such limitations, see the exceptions for each property. 应用程序使用 `suffix` 组件来区分类似的文化。The application uses the `suffix` component to distinguish similar cultures. 例如，两家公司（ABC 和 XYZ）创建并共享新的 ASP.NET Web 服务，以便在世界各地的不同市场推广其产品。For example, two companies, ABC and XYZ, create and share a new ASP.NET Web service to promote their products in different markets around the world. 服务的网页显示每个公司的区域徽标和本地电话号码等信息，具体取决于用户的文化。The Web pages for the service display information such as the regional logo and local telephone number of each company depending on the user's culture. 每个网页的区域性特定内容位于由区域性名称标识并按公司名称限定的单独资源文件中。The culture-specific content for each Web page is in separate resource files identified by culture name and qualified by company name. 例如，en-us 和 ja-jp 区域性的资源文件命名为 "en-us-ABC，en-us-XYZ，ja-日本-ABC，和 ja-jp-XYZ"。For example, resource files for the en-US and ja-JP cultures are named en-US-ABC, en-US-XYZ, ja-JP-ABC, and ja-JP-XYZ. "ABC" 和 "XYZ" 后缀使 Web 服务可以使用相同的应用程序逻辑来显示不同的市场特定信息。The "ABC" and "XYZ" suffixes enable the Web service to use the same application logic to display different market-specific information. `suffix` 组件可以由子组件组成，其中每个子组件由连字符分隔，每个子组件的最大长度为8个字符。The `suffix` component can consist of subcomponents, where each subcomponent is delimited by a hyphen and the maximum length of each subcomponent is 8 characters. 例如，如果 "en-us-honda" 是 `cultureName` 参数，则 "-honda" 是 `suffix` 组件。For example, if "en-US-honda-cars" is the `cultureName` parameter, "-honda-cars" is the `suffix` component. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个具有私有使用前缀的自定义区域性，并列出它的一组属性。The following code example creates a custom culture with a private use prefix, then lists a set of its properties. 第一个属性列出区域性的名称。The first property lists the name of the culture. [!code-cpp[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/CPP/carib.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/CS/carib.cs#1)] [!code-vb[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/VB/carib.vb#1)]

summary.span: 当默认图形用户界面区域性不合适时，获取或设置一个适合控制台应用程序的替换用户界面区域性。

span.span: Gets or sets an alternate user interface culture suitable for console applications when the default graphic user interface culture is inappropriate.

value.span: 用于在控制台上读取和显示文本的备用区域性。

span.span: An alternate culture that is used to read and display text on the console.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 get 操作中， 属性对应于 方法。In a get operation, the property corresponds to the method. 在设置操作中指定 `null`，以指示当前 对象定义的区域性是备用用户界面区域性。Specify `null` in a set operation to indicate that the culture defined by the current object is the alternate user interface culture. 如果尝试将属性设置为本身具有不同控制台回退 UI 区域性的区域性，则会为其分配最终的 "叶" 区域性。If you attempt to set the property to a culture that itself has a different Console Fallback UI Culture, then it will be assigned that final "leaf" culture. 阿拉伯语、希伯来语、波斯语、乌尔都语和叙利亚语基于双向文本。Languages such as Arabic, Hebrew, Persian, Urdu and Syriac are based on bi-directional text. 使用图形用户界面的 Windows 应用程序支持双向语言。Windows applications, which employ a graphical user interface, support bi-directional languages. 但是，使用操作系统控制台的文本用户界面的控制台应用程序不提供双向支持。However, console applications, which employ the text user interface of the operating system console, do not provide bi-directional support. 因此，如果控制台应用程序本地化为阿拉伯语或希伯来语，则它会在控制台屏幕上显示无法读取的文本。Consequently, if a console application is localized to Arabic or Hebrew, it displays unreadable text on the console screen. 用户界面区域性指定应用程序支持用户输入和输出所需的资源，默认情况下，它与操作系统区域性相同。The user interface culture specifies the resources that an application needs to support user input and output, and by default is the same as the operating system culture. 例如， 属性返回阿拉伯语操作系统的阿拉伯语区域性。For example, the property returns an Arabic culture for an Arabic operating system. 应用程序应使用 属性来检索适用于控制台应用程序用户界面的非特定区域性。The application should use the property to retrieve a neutral culture suitable for a console application user interface.

exception.span: 在指定区域性不为 的 Set 操作中，指定区域性的 属性与指定区域性不同。

span.span: In a set operation where the specified culture is not , the property of the specified culture is not the same as the specified culture.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `xmlFileName` 参数指定包含 对象的 XML 表示形式的文件名。The `xmlFileName` parameter specifies a file name that contains the XML representation of a object. XML 文件的格式称为区域设置数据标记语言（LDML）版本1.1。The format of the XML file is called Locale Data Markup Language (LDML) version 1.1. 使用 `xmlFileName`中的数据创建并初始化新的 对象。A new object is created and initialized with the data in `xmlFileName`. 方法执行 方法的反向操作。The method performs the reverse operation of the method. 在 LDML 文件中，将区域性的属性指定为 `` 部分中 `` 元素的子元素。In the LDML file, the properties of a culture are specified as child elements of the `` element in the `` section. 属性值通常由元素的 `type` 属性指定。A property value is typically specified by the element's `type` attribute. 例如，LDML 文件中的以下摘录将区域性的父级定义为英语非特定区域性。For example, the following excerpt from an LDML file defines a culture's parent as the English neutral culture. ```xml ldml version 1.1 ``` 有关 LDML 标准的详细信息，请参阅 Unicode 联合会网站上的[Unicode 技术标准 #35 "区域设置数据标记语言（LDML）"](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=252840) 。For more information about the LDML standard, see [Unicode Technical Standard #35, "Locale Data Markup Language (LDML)"](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=252840) on the Unicode Consortium website. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 和 方法。The following example demonstrates the and methods. summary.span: 获取或设置根据 RFC 4646 标准“Tags for the Identification of Languages”（语言标识标记）进行格式化的区域性名称。

span.span: Gets or sets a culture name formatted according to the RFC 4646 standard, "Tags for the Identification of Languages."

value.span: 根据 RFC 4646 格式化的区域性名称。

span.span: A culture name formatted according to RFC 4646.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性获取或设置根据 RFC 4646 进行格式化的区域性名称，这些名称可以与 属性返回的区域性名称不同。The property gets or sets a culture name formatted according to RFC 4646, which can be different from the culture name returned by the property. 例如，在 .NET Framework 版本1.0 中，繁体中文的非特定区域性名称为 "zh-chs-CHT"。For example, in the .NET Framework version 1.0, the neutral culture name for Traditional Chinese was "zh-CHT". 与此相反，RFC 4646 将该区域性名称定义为 "zh-chs-ZH-HANT"。In contrast, RFC 4646 defines that culture name as "zh-HANT". （请注意，在 .NET Framework 版本4中，"zh-chs-CHT" 的显示名称为 "中文（繁体）旧版"。）(Note that in the .NET Framework version 4, the Display Name for "zh-CHT" is "Chinese (Traditional) Legacy".) RFC 4646 区域性名称由多个组件组成。An RFC 4646 culture name consists of several components. 典型的区域性名称由必需的语言标识符、可选脚本标识符和可选的国家/地区标识符组成。A typical culture name consists of a mandatory language identifier, an optional script identifier, and an optional country/region identifier. 例如，塞尔维亚语、西里尔语脚本和塞尔维亚地区的有效 RFC 4646 区域性名称为 "Cyrl-RS"。For example, a valid RFC 4646 culture name for the Serbian language, the Cyrillic script, and the region of Serbia is "sr-Cyrl-RS". 请注意，两个或多个区域性可以具有相同的 IETF 语言标记。Note that two or more cultures can have the same IETF language tag. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 4646 ["用于识别](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=45286)语言的标记"。For more information, see RFC 4646, "Tags for the Identification of Languages," at [Request For Comments](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=45286).

summary.span: 获取当前 对象的区域性标识符。

span.span: Gets the culture identifier for the current object.

value.span: 当前 对象的区域性标识符。

summary.span: 获取或设置表示当前自定义区域性的父区域性的 对象。

span.span: Gets or sets the object that represents the parent culture of the current custom culture.

value.span: 表示当前自定义区域性的父区域性的 对象。

span.span: The object that represents the parent culture of the current custom culture.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 区域性具有层次结构。The cultures have a hierarchy. 对于预定义的区域性，特定区域性的父区域性为非特定区域性，非特定区域性的父级为 。For predefined cultures, the parent of a specific culture is a neutral culture and the parent of a neutral culture is the . 父区域性只包含其子级中通用的一组信息。The parent culture encompasses only the set of information that is common among its children. 通常建议自定义区域性符合此层次结构。It is generally recommended that custom cultures conform to this hierarchy. 但是，默认情况下，自定义区域性的 是它所基于的区域性的 。However, by default, the of a custom culture is the of the culture on which it is based. 如果应用程序创建一个基于 "en-us" "MyCulture" 的区域性，则其父级为 "en"，因为这是 "en-us" 的 。If the application creates a culture with "en-US-MyCulture" based on "en-US", its parent is "en" because that is the of "en-US". 如果应用程序使用 "en-us" 作为新的自定义区域性的 ，则必须显式设置此值。If the application uses "en-US" as the of the new custom culture, it must set this value explicitly. 如果特定区域性的资源在系统中不可用，则使用非特定区域性的资源。If the resources for the specific culture are not available in the system, the resources for the neutral culture are used. 如果非特定区域性的资源不可用，则将使用嵌入到主程序集中的资源。If the resources for the neutral culture are not available, the resources embedded in the main assembly are used. 有关资源回退进程的详细信息，请参阅[打包和部署资源](/dotnet/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps)。For more information about the resource fallback process, see [Packaging and Deploying Resources](/dotnet/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps). Windows API 中的区域性列表与 .NET Framework 中的区域性列表略有不同。The list of cultures in the Windows API is slightly different from the list of cultures in the .NET Framework. 如果需要与 Windows 之间的互操作性，例如通过平台调用机制，应用程序应使用 .NET Framework 中定义的特定区域性。If interoperability with Windows is required, for example, through the platform invoke mechanism, the application should use a specific culture that is defined in the .NET Framework. 这可确保与等效的 Windows 区域设置（用相同的 标识）保持一致。This ensures consistency with the equivalent Windows locale, which is identified with the same .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将自定义区域性作为文件存储在本地计算机上，该文件位于 Win32 [GetWindowsDirectory](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561)函数返回的目录的全球化子目录中。The method stores a custom culture as a file on the local computer, in the Globalization subdirectory of the directory returned by the Win32 [GetWindowsDirectory](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561) function. 此过程称为 "注册自定义区域性"。This process is called registering the custom culture. 注册自定义区域性后，可以通过在 构造函数中指定区域性名称或调用 方法来创建新的自定义区域性。After the custom culture is registered, a new custom culture can be created by specifying the culture name in a constructor or when calling the method. 可以通过调用 方法来删除自定义区域性。The custom culture can be removed by calling the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法。The following example demonstrates the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性对应于 属性。The property corresponds to the property. 属性值是在 ISO 3166 中为国家/地区定义的由两个字母组成的代码之一。The property value is one of the two-letter codes defined in ISO 3166 for country/region. 例如，美国的双字母代码为 "US"。For example, the two-letter code for United States is "US". 预定义的 名称在 类主题中列出。The predefined names are listed in the class topic.

summary.span: 从本地计算机中删除自定义区域性。

span.span: Deletes a custom culture from the local computer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法执行 方法的反向。The method does the reverse of the method. 方法将自定义区域性作为文件存储在本地计算机上，该文件位于 Windows API [GetWindowsDirectory](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561)函数返回的目录的全球化子目录中。The method stores a custom culture as a file on the local computer, in the Globalization subdirectory of the directory returned by the Windows API [GetWindowsDirectory](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561) function. 方法将从计算机中删除持久的自定义区域性文件。The method deletes the persisted custom culture file from the computer. 删除该文件后，计算机内存中自定义区域性的现有实例将继续运行，但不能创建自定义区域性的新实例。After the file is deleted, existing instances of the custom culture in computer memory continue to work, but new instances of the custom culture cannot be created. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法。The following example demonstrates the method.
